Legal_Issue: Failure to comply with a court order to provide documents
Governing_Law: Rule 466(b) of the Federal Courts Rules
Evidence_Assessment: Respondent was served with the order, failed to comply, did not appear in court or contact CRA
Decision_Outcome: Found guilty of contempt of court
Legal_Rule: A person is guilty of contempt for disobeying a court order under Rule 466(b)
Procedural_Issue: Non-appearance and lack of communication from respondent
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to provide required financial documents as per court order
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Show cause order issued, hearing held, evidence presented
Key_Evidence_Considered: Service of order, non-compliance, absence from court, no contact with CRA
Applicant_Challenge: Enforcement of court order for document production
Court_Result: Respondent fined $3,000, ordered to pay $2,000 in legal costs, must produce documents within 30 days or face imprisonment
Defendant_Response: No response, did not appear in court or contact CRA
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, proof of service, procedural records
Remedy_Requested: Compliance with document production order, penalties for non-compliance
Outcome: Guilty verdict, financial penalties, conditional imprisonment
Remedy_Sought: Production of documents, fine, cost award, potential imprisonment
Legal_Provision_Cited: Rule 466(b) of the Federal Courts Rules
Applicable_Process: Contempt proceeding via motion and show cause order
Governing_Rule: Rule 466(b) of the Federal Courts Rules
